bug.author: jseppanen
bug.summary: Calling self.log fails with: 'LitClassifier' object has no attribute 'log'
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Calling self.log(...) fails with torch.nn.modules.module.ModuleAttributeError: 'LitClassifier' object has no attribute 'log' <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>$¬†python pl_examples/basic_examples/mnist.py Downloading http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz 99%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñâ | 9789440/9912422 [00:01<00:00, 2487387.89it/s]Extracting MNIST/raw/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw Downloading http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz Extracting MNIST/raw/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw | 16384/28881 [00:00<00:00, 156850.09it/s] Downloading http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist/t10k-images-idx3-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw/t10k-images-idx3-ubyte.gz Extracting MNIST/raw/t10k-images-idx3-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw Downloading http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/mnist/t10k-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw/t10k-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz:00<00:01, 491443.56it/s] 9920512it [00:03, 3030956.24it/s] 32768it [00:01, 22745.39it/s] 1654784it [00:01, 1581939.35it/s] 0it [00:00, ?it/s] Extracting MNIST/raw/t10k-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz to MNIST/raw Processing... /home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torchvision/datasets/mnist.py:469: UserWarning: The given NumPy array is not writeable, and PyTorch does not support non-writeable tensors. This means you can write to the underlying (supposedly non-writeable) NumPy array using the tensor. You may want to copy the array to protect its data or make it writeable before converting it to a tensor. This type of warning will be suppressed for the rest of this program. (Triggered internally at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1595629427478/work/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp:141.) return torch.from_numpy(parsed.astype(m[2], copy=False)).view(*s) Done! GPU available: False, used: False TPU available: False, using: 0 TPU cores /home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/utilities/distributed.py:37: UserWarning: Could not log computational graph since the `model.example_input_array` attribute is not set or `input_array` was not given warnings.warn(*args, **kwargs)
| Name | Type | Params -------------------------------- 0 | l1 | Linear | 100 K 1 | l2 | Linear | 1 K /home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/utilities/distributed.py:37: UserWarning: The dataloader, val dataloader 0, does not have many workers which may be a bottleneck. Consider increasing the value of the `num_workers` argument` (try 8 which is the number of cpus on this machine) in the `DataLoader` init to improve performance. warnings.warn(*args, **kwargs) Validation sanity check: 0it [00:00, ?it/s]Traceback (most recent call last): File "pl_examples/basic_examples/mnist.py", line 112, in <module> cli_main() File "pl_examples/basic_examples/mnist.py", line 103, in cli_main trainer.fit(model, train_loader, val_loader) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/states.py", line 48, in wrapped_fn result = fn(self, *args, **kwargs) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py", line 1084, in fit results = self.accelerator_backend.train(model) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/accelerators/cpu_backend.py", line 39, in train results = self.trainer.run_pretrain_routine(model) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py", line 1224, in run_pretrain_routine self._run_sanity_check(ref_model, model) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py", line 1257, in _run_sanity_check eval_results = self._evaluate(model, self.val_dataloaders, max_batches, False) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/evaluation_loop.py", line 333, in _evaluate output = self.evaluation_forward(model, batch, batch_idx, dataloader_idx, test_mode) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/evaluation_loop.py", line 687, in evaluation_forward output = model.validation_step(*args) File "pl_examples/basic_examples/mnist.py", line 52, in validation_step self.log('valid_loss', loss) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 772, in __getattr__ type(self).__name__, name)) torch.nn.modules.module.ModuleAttributeError: 'LitClassifier' object has no attribute 'log' 8192it [00:00, 13214.65it/s] </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Running mnist.py should train MNIST classifier without errors. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
CUDA:
GPU: available: False version: 10.2
Packages:
numpy: 1.19.1 pyTorch_debug: False pyTorch_version: 1.6.0 pytorch-lightning: 0.9.0 tqdm: 4.50.0
System:
OS: Linux architecture:
64bit
processor: x86_64 python: 3.7.9 version: #46~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jul 10 07:21:24 UTC 2020

comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!

I tried downgrading pytorch to 1.5.1 but the error remains (though the exception class is now different, AttributeError): <denchmark-code>... File "pl_examples/basic_examples/mnist.py", line 52, in validation_step self.log('valid_loss', loss) File "/home/jarno/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 594, in __getattr__ type(self).__name__, name)) AttributeError: 'LitClassifier' object has no attribute 'log' </denchmark-code>
Please update to v0.10.0 (or master) as self.log is a newly feature introduced.

That worked, thanks for your help! File under: race condition in documentation üòÖ <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83203/95486756-18c45400-099c-11eb-8d79-693043f24156.png></denchmark-link>
